SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
INDUSTRIES COMMON FEATURES GUIDE
Formulas

With the Formula node, you can create multiple formulas and store the results of each formula in a new field.

REQUIRED EDITIONS
Available in: Lightning Experience
Available in: Enterprise, Unlimited, and Professional Editions with Financial Services Cloud, Manufacturing Cloud, Loyalty Management, Net Zero Cloud, Rebate Management, Accounting Subledger, or Provider Search in Health Cloud

Before you create a formula, specify the alias, data type, and format of the derived field. The derived field can be of these types.

Date
Date/Time
Numeric

Specify the length and the decimal places of the numeric field. The length can be up to 17 digits.

Text

To create a formula, use fields, functions, and operators. Pick a field, an operator, and a function in any combination to create a formula. You can also pick an input variable as a field.

WARNING The number of formula fields you can create in a Formula node is calculated by adding the fields in the source node and the custom formula fields created.

Use these function types and functions to create a formula.

FUNCTION TYPE	FUNCTION	DESCRIPTION
Math	ABS	Calculates the absolute value of a number. The absolute value of a number is the number without its positive or negative sign.
Math	CEILING	Rounds a number up to the nearest integer, away from zero if negative.
Math	EXP	Returns a value for e raised to the power of a number you specify.
Math	FLOOR	Returns a number rounded down to the nearest integer. If the number is negative, it’s rounded up to the nearest integer.
Math	LOG	Returns the logarithm of a number in the base you specify.
Math	MAX	Returns the highest number from a list of numbers.
Math	MIN	Returns the lowest number from a list of numbers.
Math	MOD	Returns a remainder after a number is divided by a specified divisor.
Math	POWER	Raises a number to the power of another number.
Math	ROUND	Returns the nearest number to a number you specify, constraining the new number by a specified number of digits.
Math	SQRT	Returns the positive square root of a given number.
Math	TRUNC	Truncates the specified number of decimal values from the number.
String	BEGINS	Returns true if the string starts with the specified characters.
String	CONCAT	Returns a string by connecting the values of the specified columns and input strings.
String	CONTAINS	Compares two arguments of text and returns TRUE if the first argument contains the second argument. If not, it returns FALSE.
String	ENDS	Returns true if the specified string is found at the end of the column value.
String	LENGTH	Returns the number of characters in a text.
String	LOWER	Returns the string with all letters in the specified text string to lowercase. Any characters that aren’t letters are unaffected by this function. Locale rules are applied if a locale is provided.
String	LTRIM	Removes the left part of a string up to the specified characters, or removes leading spaces.
String	RTRIM	Removes the right part of a string back to the specified characters, or removes trailing spaces.
String	SUBSTITUTE	Substitutes new text for old text in a text string.
String	SUBSTR	Returns characters from the string, starting at the specified position and of the specified length.
String	TEXT	Converts a value that represents a number to a text string that represents the same number.
String	TRIM	Removes the spaces and tabs from the beginning and end of a text string.
String	UPPER	Returns the string with all letters in the specified text string to uppercase. Any characters that aren’t letters are unaffected by this function. Locale rules are applied if a locale is provided.
String	UUID	Returns a newly generated unique ID.
String	VALUE	Converts a text string that represents a number to a value that represents the same number.
Date	ADDDAYS	Returns a new date after adding the specified number of days.
Date	ADDMONTHS	Returns the date with the specified number of months after the start date.
Date	DATEDIFF	Returns the number of days between start date and end date.
Date	DATETIMEVALUE	Returns a year, month, day, and GMT time value.
Date	DATEVALUE	Returns a date value for a date/time or text expression.
Date	DAY	Returns a day of the month in the form of a number from 1 through 31.
Date	MONTHDIFF	Returns the number of months between start date and end date.
Date	NOW	Returns a date/time representing the current moment in UTC (GMT).
Date	TODAY	Returns the current date as a date data type.
Date	WEEKDAY	Return the day of the week for the given date, using 1 for Sunday, 2 for Monday, through 7 for Saturday.
Logical	AND	Returns a TRUE response if all values are true. Returns a FALSE response if one or more values are false.
Logical	BLANKVALUE	Checks whether an expression is blank. If the expression is blank, substitute_expression is returned. If the expression contains a value, that value is returned.
Logical	CASE	Checks a given expression against a series of values. If the expression is equal to a value, it returns the corresponding result. If it isn’t equal to any values, it returns the else_result.
Logical	IF	Determines if expressions are true or false. Returns a given value if true and another value if false.
Logical	ISBLANK	Checks whether an expression is blank. If the expression is blank, TRUE is returned. If the expression contains a value, FALSE is returned.
Logical	ISNULL	Determines if an expression is null (blank) and returns TRUE if it’s blank. If it contains a value, the function returns FALSE.
Logical	NULLVALUE	Checks whether expression isn’t null and returns substitute expression. If expression is null, it returns the original expression value.
Logical	OR	Determines if expressions are true or false. Returns TRUE if any expression is true. Returns FALSE if all expressions are false.

After you create a formula, check if the syntax is valid. The result of this node includes all the fields from the source node and the formula fields you create.

If a field that’s used in a formula is removed from the source node, ensure that you manually remove the field from the formula.

EXAMPLE To uniquely identify every employee with the department they belong to, the formula is: {FirstName}+ {LastName} + {Department}. The formula field must be of the type Text.
Compute Relative Transformation
Use the Compute Relative transformation in a Formula node to partition data and order the data within the partition based on source object fields. Create formulas to determine the trends of specific fields.
